portfolio.title: Better Off
portfolio.description: Better Off is a planning service that produces legal documents. Its an all-together document generating platform that allows you to automatically translate your plan or will into state-specific legal documents, and share them with the people who’ll carry out your wishes when you die. You can build your full plan and download a limited but fully functional advance healthcare directive without paying anything. You only need to pay when you’re ready to download a more robust healthcare directive and other legal documents, which, depending on the plan you set, could include a will, a power of attorney to ensure care for minor children if you're incapacitated, and a transfer on death deed. Pay far less than the cost of traditional legal services to put your mind at ease. It is built with Webflow. Ive used wized make the site dynamic, interactive and responsive. I've used Xano to make the backend. As the backend engineer i was able to ensure personal information and plan will be protected with SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, and ISO 9001 encryption standards, the same standards commonly used by major financial institutions for data protection. Better Off is also compliant with HIPAA requirements.

portfolio.title: Xano API & React
portfolio.description:
I was researching on how best to create APIs with Xano for a wized project i was undertaking.
I thought of my react portofolio which had hardcoded blog elements. I thought why not use a Xano API instead for my react portfolio.
So utilising useEffect and useState combo so that onComponent mount, this page fires a get request to a xano endpoint and xano returns an ordered list of projects in json which i use Array.map()
to produce a dynamic list of elements. Infact this page your reading now gets json data from a xano database!

portfolio.title: CI/CD Pipeline
portfolio.description:
I got bored deploying react code on vercel. Coming from a linux backgroud, I wrote my CI-CD Workflow that emulates vercel in my VM to automate code deployment using github actions. I setup a Github Hosted runner and wrote a custom YAML File to enable the runner build, test, 
automatically deploy the app on my RHEL VM. I was able to setup custom users and passwordless SSH Keys that enable runners to automatically SSH into, CD into my deployment directory and deploy my react portfolio. All i have to do is push my JS changes
incrementally and my workflow will test and deploy my portfolio to my custom domain on an EC2 Instance. I wrote a whole blog on how JS Devs can use github actions, runners, workflows and linux to automate deployments
